original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na mdza' bo'i bu mor gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nga yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na mdza' bo'i bu mor gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nga yin te /

analyzed: ngas nyo tshong byas nas ma la k'arsh'a pa na phul ba'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ni grong khyer chen po bzhir bde ba chen po myong ngo //

analyzed: ngas ma la gnod pa chung ngu byas pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ni de lta bu'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Bhikṣus,

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: therefore you should train thinking,

original: pha ma la bkur sti bya'o //
analyzed: pha ma la bkur sti bya'o //

original: gnod pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa mi bya'o //
translated: We will not harm them.’

original: 'on tang mdza' bo'i bu mo so so'i skye bor gyur pa'i tshe nyes pa de dag lta bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on tang mdza' bo'i bu mo so so'i skye bor gyur pa'i tshe nyes pa de dag lta bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /

translated: Bhikṣus, you should train thinking, ‘We will attain the good qualities that the god’s son has attained.’🔽“

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: bu'i pha ma gnyis ni dka' ba byed pa dang / skom ldud pa dang / gso ba dang / bskyed pa dang / num snun pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling bkra ba ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu'i pha ma gnyis ni dka' ba byed pa dang / skom ldud pa dang / gso ba dang / bskyed pa dang / num snun pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling bkra ba ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the parents of a child are the ones who do difficult things for the child, who give the child food and drink, who raise the child, who nurse the child, and who show the child the beautiful world.

analyzed: gal te bus pha ma gnyis phrag pa g-yas g-yon du bzhag ste lo brgya'i bar du khyer ram /

translated: or if he were to give them dominion over this great earth filled with the seven precious substances,🔽that would not be enough for the child to have repaid his parents’ kindness

original: phan btags par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phan btags par mi 'gyur gyi /

original: gang gis pha ma de gnyis dad pa med pa las dad pa phun sum tshogs pa la 'dzud pa dang / 'dul ba dang / gnas par byed pa dang / 'jog par byed pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba las tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang /

translated: to be disciplined, to abide, to be settled, and to be established in perfect morality,🔽generosity, and wisdom, having caused them to abandon immorality,

analyzed: bus pha ma gnyis la drin bsabs pa'am /

original: phan btags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /

analyzed: dge slong de dag @160a *//
translated: those monks

analyzed: ri bong zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / nam mkha' lding rnams dang / mi'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bkur stir byas /

analyzed: ri mor byas; mchod pa byas te /
translated: a great bull of a seer of the Śākyas,🔽a great bull of a man,🔽a great bull of a man of the Śākyas,🔽a great bull of a sage,🔽a great bull of a sage of the Śākyas,🔽a great bull of a seer,🔽a great bull of a seer of the Śākyas,🔽a great bull of a man,🔽a great bull of a man of the Śākyas,🔽a great bull of a sage,🔽a great bull of a sage of the Śākyas,

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis mchod cing shes pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsod nams chen po dang ldan pa /

analyzed: de'i tshe mnyan du yod pa na tshong dpon phyug cing nor mngal longs spyod che ba /
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī there was a wealthy merchant who had great riches and possessions,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: who had vast and extensive wealth,🔽who was equal in wealth to Vaiśravaṇa,

analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang 'gran pa zhig yod de /

analyzed: des rigs @160b mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /

analyzed: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las phyi zhig na chung ma la bu chags nas /

original: de zla ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: de zla ba brgyad dam /

original: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
analyzed: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
translated: After nine months had passed, she gave birth.

analyzed: khye'u zhig btsas nas de bskyed bsrings te cher gyur to //
translated: A boy was born, and they raised him and he grew up.

original: de'i pha ni nor yang zad par gyur /
analyzed: de'i pha ni nor yang zad par gyur /
translated: His father’s wealth was exhausted,

original: longs spyod kyang zad par gyur to //
analyzed: longs spyod kyang zad par gyur to //
translated: and his enjoyments were exhausted.

original: de'ang mdza' bo dang / nye du dang / rtsa lag gi 'dab che ba zhig ste /
analyzed: de'ang mdza' bo dang / nye du dang / rtsa lag gi 'dab che ba zhig ste /
translated: He had many friends, relatives, and kinsmen,

original: bu de dus dus su nye du rnams kyi thad du gtong ngo //
analyzed: bu de dus dus su nye du rnams kyi thad du gtong ngo //
translated: and he sent his son to his relatives from time to time.

analyzed: de nas de nye du de dag gis ci nas de dag kyang phyir zhing mdza' bar 'gyur ba de lta bur gzhan to //

analyzed: phyis re zhig na de rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas /
translated: Later, after some time, he went to the Jetavana.

original: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: He saw the Blessed Buddha, his body well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcu  mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcu  mdzes par byas pa /
translated: embellished with the eighty minor marks,

original: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a fathom-wide halo,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
translated: shining with a light surpassing the brilliance of a thousand suns,

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang ba mthong ngo //
translated: It is like a mountain of jewels, beautiful in every way.🔽

original: mthong nas kyang dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang dga' bar gyur te /
translated: He saw the Blessed One from afar, beautiful like a mountain of jewels, and when he saw him, he was delighted.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: He bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat before him to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'khor ba las skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'khor ba las skyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One taught him the Dharma that would cause him to feel revulsion for cyclic existence.

original: de thos pas 'khor ba la nyes par lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du lta bar gyur te /
analyzed: de thos pas 'khor ba la nyes par lta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du lta bar gyur te /
translated: When he heard it, he came to see faults in cyclic existence and to see the virtues of nirvāṇa.

original: pha ma gnyis kyis gnang nas /
analyzed: pha ma gnyis kyis gnang nas /
translated: With his parents’ permission,

original: bcom @161a *// ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom @161a *// ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ngo //
translated: he went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One.

original: de de ltar rab tu byung nas nye du de dag dang lhan cig tu 'du zhing gnas so //
analyzed: de de ltar rab tu byung nas nye du de dag dang lhan cig tu 'du zhing gnas so //
translated: After going forth, he continued to associate with and visit his relatives.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de khyim pa dang 'du ba las bzlog nas dgon par gnas pa la 'dzud par mdzad na de der mi dga'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One turned him away from associating with householders and had him live in the wilderness, but he did not like that.

original: de nas de bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsum gyi bar du khyim pa dang 'du ba las bzlog par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas de bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsum gyi bar du khyim pa dang 'du ba las bzlog par mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, up to three times, turned him away from associating with householders.

original: bu; khyim pa dang 'du ba 'di ni nyes pa du ma dang ldan te /
analyzed: bu; khyim pa dang 'du ba 'di ni nyes pa du ma dang ldan te /
translated: “Son, this associating with householders has many faults.

original: mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs sdug pa dang / phangs pa dang / snying du sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang / tsher ma dang 'dra ba dang / rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams dang /
analyzed: mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs sdug pa dang / phangs pa dang / snying du sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang / tsher ma dang 'dra ba dang / rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams dang /
translated: There are forms that are cognizable by the eye, which are attractive, dear, pleasant, delightful, desirable, delightful, and like thorns. There are sounds cognizable by the ear,

original: snas shes par bya ba'i dri rnams dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro rnams dang / lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya rnams dang / sdug pa dang / phangs pa dang / snying du sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: snas shes par bya ba'i dri rnams dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro rnams dang / lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya rnams dang / sdug pa dang / phangs pa dang / snying du sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang /
translated: smells cognizable by the nose, tastes cognizable by the tongue, and touchables cognizable by the body, which are attractive, dear, pleasant, delightful,

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang / tsher ma dang 'dra ba dag yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang / tsher ma dang 'dra ba dag yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: desirable, delightful, and like thorns.”

original: gang du gnas bcas na dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i dgon pa'i yon tan dag kyang rnam grangs du mar bsngags so //
analyzed: gang du gnas bcas na dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i dgon pa'i yon tan dag kyang rnam grangs du mar bsngags so //
translated: He also praised the qualities of the forest life, which is where virtuous qualities increase.

original: de nas re zhig na rigs kyi bu des dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das la brten nas /
analyzed: de nas re zhig na rigs kyi bu des dge ba'i bshes gnyen bcom ldan 'das la brten nas /
translated: Then, at one point, that son of noble family, relying on the spiritual friend, the Blessed One,🔽always exerted himself in living in the forest, and through practice and effort, he understood that this wheel of the five-spoked existence is unstable and unsteady.

original: dgon par gnas pa la'ang rtag tu brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / @161b 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad rnyil ba dang / ltung ba dang /
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa la'ang rtag tu brtson pa dang / bsgrub pa dang / @161b 'bad pas phol mig lnga pa'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo 'di nyid g-yo zhing mi brtan par rig nas 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad rnyil ba dang / ltung ba dang /
translated: He resolved that all aspects of conditioned existence are subject to decay, falling,

original: rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can yin par rtsad chod de /
translated: dispersal, and destruction.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas te /
translated: He abandoned all afflictive emotions and actualized arhatship.

original: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
translated: As an arhat, free from the attachments of the three realms,

original: gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
analyzed: gser dang bong bar mnyam pa /
translated: he was equal to gold and earth.

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du 'dra ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: His mind was like the sky or the palm of the hand.

original: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
analyzed: tsandan spangs pa lta bur bsil bar gyur pa /
translated: He was cool like sandalwood.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs bcom pa /
translated: He had broken the shell of ignorance with his knowledge.

original: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: He had attained knowledge, insight, and the superknowledges.

original: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur sti la mi blta ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rnyed pa dang / chags pa dang / bkur sti la mi blta ba /
translated: He was not concerned with the acquisitions, attachments, and honors of cyclic existence.

original: dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang / nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod cing rjed pa dang / gus par smra ba'i gnas su gyur to //
translated: He was an object of offering, worship, and praise by the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: de nas des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran la /
analyzed: de nas des sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran la /
translated: Then he remembered his past lives.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu dka' ba spyod pa'ang mthong nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu dka' ba spyod pa'ang mthong nas /
translated: He saw that the Blessed One had also undergone great hardships.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du song ste /

original: kun tu rab tu 'bar ste /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'bar ste /
translated: and burning all over,

original: me lce gcig tu 'bar nas /
analyzed: me lce gcig tu 'bar nas /
translated: with a single tongue of flame.

original: tshig cing nyam thag pa'i skad 'byin la /
analyzed: tshig cing nyam thag pa'i skad 'byin la /
translated: She was crying out in pain and distress,

original: sdug bsngal drag pa dang / mi bzad pa dang / tsha ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba nyams su myong ba lnga brgya khva khyus lding ba bzhin du nam mkha' la 'khor te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal drag pa dang / mi bzad pa dang / tsha ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba nyams su myong ba lnga brgya khva khyus lding ba bzhin du nam mkha' la 'khor te /
translated: and experiencing intense, unbearable, excruciating, and unpleasant feelings. She was flying through the sky like a flock of crows,

original: gang du'ang 'dug sa mi rnyed do //
analyzed: gang du'ang 'dug sa mi rnyed do //
translated: but she could not find a place to rest anywhere.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu snga dro sham thabs dang / chos gos bgos te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu snga dro sham thabs dang / chos gos bgos te /
translated: Then, in the morning, the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana put on his lower and upper robes,

original: lhung bzed thogs nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed thogs nas /
translated: took his alms bowl,

original: rgyal po'i khab du bsod snyoms la song ba dang / des yi dvags de dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab du bsod snyoms la song ba dang / des yi dvags de dag mthong ngo //
translated: and went to Rājagṛha for alms. He saw those hungry ghosts.

original: yi dvags de dag gis kyang tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po mthong ngo //
analyzed: yi dvags de dag gis kyang tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po mthong ngo //
translated: Those hungry ghosts also saw the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana.

original: de nas de dag gcig tu 'dril nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po'i thad du dong ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag gcig tu 'dril nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po'i thad du dong ste /
translated: Then, having gathered together, they went to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana.

original: phyi nas snying rje rje skad zer zhing sdug sdug skad zer la gti zhing smra bar tshig mthun par smras pa /
analyzed: phyi nas snying rje rje skad zer zhing sdug sdug skad zer la gti zhing smra bar tshig mthun par smras pa /
translated: With sorrowful voices, they spoke these words in unison:

original: btsun pa mo'u dgal gyi bu /
analyzed: btsun pa mo'u dgal gyi bu /
translated: “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: bdag cag ni rgyal po'i khab tu tshong dpon lnga brgyar gyur te /
analyzed: bdag cag ni rgyal po'i khab tu tshong dpon lnga brgyar gyur te /
translated: we were the five hundred guild masters in Rājagṛha.

original: @193b bdag cag ser sna can 'jungs pa yo byad rnams la kun tu 'dzin par gyur nas /
analyzed: @193b bdag cag ser sna can 'jungs pa yo byad rnams la kun tu 'dzin par gyur nas /
translated: We were stingy, greedy, and held on to our possessions.

original: bdag cag nyid kyis kyang sbyin pa ma byin la /
analyzed: bdag cag nyid kyis kyang sbyin pa ma byin la /
translated: We did not give any gifts ourselves.

original: gzhan dag sbyin pa byed pa la'ang bgegs byas so //🔽sbyin pa'i gnas rnams la yang yi dvags kyi tshig lta bus mang du sbyos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag sbyin pa byed pa la'ang bgegs byas so // sbyin pa'i gnas rnams la yang yi dvags kyi tshig lta bus mang du sbyos te /
translated: They also created obstacles for others who were practicing generosity.🔽They also scolded those who were worthy of offerings, saying, “You are like hungry ghosts.

original: khyod ni yi dvags su skyes pa bzhin du gzhan gyi khyim phyi nyug pa'o zhes byas so //
analyzed: khyod ni yi dvags su skyes pa bzhin du gzhan gyi khyim phyi nyug pa'o zhes byas so //
translated: You are like hungry ghosts who wander from house to house.”

original: des na bdag cag shi ba'i 'og tu 'di lta bu'i yi dvags su skyes so //
analyzed: des na bdag cag shi ba'i 'og tu 'di lta bu'i yi dvags su skyes so //
translated: Therefore, after we died, we were reborn as hungry ghosts like this.

original: btsun pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po /
analyzed: btsun pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: de bas na bdag cag gi nye du rgyal po'i khab na gnas pa de dag la bdag cag gi las kyi rnam pa shes par mdzod la dad pa dris te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag cag gi nye du rgyal po'i khab na gnas pa de dag la bdag cag gi las kyi rnam pa shes par mdzod la dad pa dris te /
translated: therefore, please tell our relatives who live in Rājagṛha about the kind of karma we have created and the faith we have.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos gsol nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos gsol nas /
translated: They should invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to a meal,

original: bdag cag gi slad du yon gyi rabs 'don par gsol cig /
analyzed: bdag cag gi slad du yon gyi rabs 'don par gsol cig /
translated: and recite the praises of generosity on our behalf.

original: 'on tang bdag cag yi dvags kyi skye gnas nas thar kyang srid do zhes gsungs shig /
analyzed: 'on tang bdag cag yi dvags kyi skye gnas nas thar kyang srid do zhes gsungs shig /
translated: Perhaps then we will be freed from the realm of hungry ghosts.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bus kyang yi dvags rnams la cang mi smra bas khas blangs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bus kyang yi dvags rnams la cang mi smra bas khas blangs so //
translated: Then the Venerable Maudgalyāyana accepted the invitation of the hungry ghosts by remaining silent.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bus de dag gi nye du rnams kyi khyim khyim du dad pa dris nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bus de dag gi nye du rnams kyi khyim khyim du dad pa dris nas /
translated: Then the Venerable Maudgalyāyana asked the relatives of those hungry ghosts in their homes for the offerings.

original: phyi de nyin sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos la spyan drangs so //
analyzed: phyi de nyin sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos la spyan drangs so //
translated: The next day he invited the Buddha and the community of monks to a meal.

original: yi dvags rnams la'ang sbran te /
analyzed: yi dvags rnams la'ang sbran te /
translated: He also informed the hungry ghosts:

original: sang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bshos la spyan drangs kyi khyed kyang der shog cig ces byas so //
analyzed: sang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bshos la spyan drangs kyi khyed kyang der shog cig ces byas so //
translated: “Tomorrow I will invite the Blessed One and the community of monks to a meal. You should also come there.”

original: de dag gi nye du rnams la'ang @194a *//
analyzed: de dag gi nye du rnams la'ang @194a *//
translated: He also said to the relatives of those hungry ghosts:

original: khyed kyang shog cig dang / nye du'i mchod ston byed pa der yi dvags de dag mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes byas so //
analyzed: khyed kyang shog cig dang / nye du'i mchod ston byed pa der yi dvags de dag mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes byas so //
translated: “You should also come, and you will see those hungry ghosts at the offering of the relatives.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu nyid mchod ston gyi zhal ta byed pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu nyid mchod ston gyi zhal ta byed pa la zhugs so //
translated: Then the Venerable Maudgalyāyana himself took charge of the preparations for the offering.

original: de nas nam nangs nas zhal zas bshams te /
analyzed: de nas nam nangs nas zhal zas bshams te /
translated: Then, when it was morning, the food was prepared.

original: gdugs tshod la bab na yi dvags de dag mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gdugs tshod la bab na yi dvags de dag mi snang ngo //
translated: When it was time for the meal, the hungry ghosts disappeared.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos lha'i mig gis yi dvags de dag bsams na /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos lha'i mig gis yi dvags de dag bsams na /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­Maudgalyāyana, with his divine eye, looked for those hungry ghosts,

original: yul ma ga dha thog thag na'ang mi snang la /
analyzed: yul ma ga dha thog thag na'ang mi snang la /
translated: but he did not see them anywhere in Magadha.🔽He looked as far as the four continents, but he did not see them there either.

original: mthar gyis gling bzhi'i bar du bltas na'ang de na yang mi snang ngo; ;de nas ji srid du de'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa de srid du bltas kyang de na'ang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: mthar gyis gling bzhi'i bar du bltas na'ang de na yang mi snang ngo; ;de nas ji srid du de'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa de srid du bltas kyang de na'ang mi snang ngo //
translated: Then, as far as his knowledge and insight extended, he looked, but he did not see them there either.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po mi dga' bar gyur nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po mi dga' bar gyur nas / bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­Maudgalyāyana, unhappy,🔽told the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag gi sbyin bdag de rnams mi gda' lags so //
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin bdag de rnams mi gda' lags so //
translated: I do not see those benefactors.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mo'u dgal gyi bu /
analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: thongs la / khyod mi dgar ma byed cig /
analyzed: thongs la / khyod mi dgar ma byed cig /
translated: let go, do not be unhappy.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag yod de /
translated: “There are countless world systems beyond the realms of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: de dag tu las kyi rlung gis 'phangs mod kyi; 'on kyang mo'u dgal gyi bu /
analyzed: de dag tu las kyi rlung gis 'phangs mod kyi; 'on kyang mo'u dgal gyi bu /
translated: Although they are propelled by the wind of karma, Maudgalyāyana,

original: deng de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la ltos shig /
analyzed: deng de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la ltos shig /
translated: look at the power of the Thus-Gone One now.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gzigs pa mngon par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gzigs pa mngon par bya'o //
translated: I will manifest the vision of omniscient wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu @194b 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'ang bstan gyi gandi rdungs shig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu @194b 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'ang bstan gyi gandi rdungs shig /
translated: I will also display the Thus-Gone One’s miraculous manifestations, so beat the gong.”

original: de nas gandi brdungs pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad kyang 'dus /
analyzed: de nas gandi brdungs pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad kyang 'dus /
translated: When the gong was beaten, the entire saṅgha of monks gathered.

analyzed: yi dvags kyi nye du rnams dang / yi dvags mthong bar 'dod pa'i sems can gzhan dag kyang ltad mo la lhags te 'dus so //
translated: The hungry ghosts’ relatives and other beings who wished to see the hungry ghosts also came and gathered for the spectacle.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas yi dvags rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bshos gsol ba mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag cag gi phyir nye du rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bshos gsol zhing 'khod do snyam du dran pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul bstan to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas yi dvags rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa bshos gsol ba mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag cag gi phyir nye du rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams bshos gsol zhing 'khod do snyam du dran pa rnyed par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul bstan to //
translated: and they remembered, “Our relatives are sitting, having invited the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks to eat our food.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung yan lag lnga dang ldan pas yon gyi rabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung yan lag lnga dang ldan pas yon gyi rabs gsungs pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke the verses of the benefits of generosity with a voice having five aspects:

original: sbyin pa 'di yi bsod nams gang //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di yi bsod nams gang //
translated: “Whatever merit there is in this generosity,

original: de ni yi dvags phyi bzhin song //🔽yi dvags 'jig rten rab 'jigs las //
analyzed: de ni yi dvags phyi bzhin song // yi dvags 'jig rten rab 'jigs las //
translated: may it follow the hungry ghosts.

original: de dag myur du thar gyur cig /
analyzed: de dag myur du thar gyur cig /
translated: May they quickly be liberated

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: from the terrifying world of hungry ghosts.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi de las brten nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi de las brten nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, based on that situation, taught the Dharma in a way that was relevant to them.

original: de thos nas srog chags 'bum phrag du mas ser sna'i dri ma spangs te /
analyzed: de thos nas srog chags 'bum phrag du mas ser sna'i dri ma spangs te /
translated: When they heard this, many hundreds of thousands of living beings abandoned the defilement of stinginess,

original: bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
translated: and saw the truth.

analyzed: yi dvags de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur te shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes so //
translated: Those hungry ghosts, too, felt joy toward the Blessed One, and when they died they were reborn in the good company of the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha'i bu'am / lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems @195a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu'am / lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems @195a *//
translated: It is natural that when a god or goddess is newly born,

analyzed: rnam pa gsum skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: three thoughts arise in his or her mind:

original: gang nas shi 'phos /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos /
translated: “Where did I die?”

original: gang du skyes /
analyzed: gang du skyes /
translated: “Where was I reborn?”

translated: “Because of what action was I reborn here?”🔽Then the gods who had been hungry ghosts saw that they had died and transmigrated from there, and that they had been reborn in the good company of the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and that it was because they had felt joy toward the Blessed One.

original: de nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the gods who had been hungry ghosts thought,🔽“

analyzed: bdag cag zhag lon te gzod bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni bdag cag gi cha ma yin gyi /
translated: “It is not right for us to wait a day before going to see the Blessed One.

original: bdag cag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'dong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag cag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'dong ngo snyam mo //
translated: We should go to see the Blessed One this very day.”

original: de nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing mgul pa thogs pa /🔽lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
analyzed: de nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing mgul pa thogs pa / lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
translated: Then the sons of the former pretas, their earrings and necklaces🔽adorned with precious stones,

original: nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i cod pan can /
translated: their heads crowned with jewels,

original: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la la sogs pas byugs pa de rnams kyis de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang; padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
analyzed: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la la sogs pas byugs pa de rnams kyis de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang; padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
translated: their bodies anointed with saffron, tamala leaves, and spṛka sandalwood, filled their upper robes with divine blue lotus, lotus, white water lily, white lotus, and mandārava flowers,

original: 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa kho ra khor yug 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa kho ra khor yug 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
translated: and, illuminating the entire Jeta Grove with their splendor,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
translated: they scattered the flowers over the Blessed One.

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: They then sat down in the presence of the Blessed One in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa @195b dang; bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de ngang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa @195b dang; bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de ngang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One knew the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the sons of gods who had previously been hungry ghosts, and taught them the Dharma accordingly.

original: de thos nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis khyad par chen po thob po; ;de dag tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa bzhin du gyur te /
analyzed: de thos nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis khyad par chen po thob po; ;de dag tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa bzhin du gyur te /
translated: When they heard it, the sons of gods who had previously been hungry ghosts attained a great distinction. They were like merchants who had made a profit.

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: They circumambulated the Blessed One three times and then disappeared.

original: der bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One then said to the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana,

original: mo'u dgal gyi bu /
analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: khyod kyis yi dvags mang po dag lha'i nang du bkod nas de dag kyang mdang sum nga'i thad du 'ongs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis yi dvags mang po dag lha'i nang du bkod nas de dag kyang mdang sum nga'i thad du 'ongs te /
translated: you have established many hungry ghosts in the god realms, and last night they came to me.

original: de dag la ngas chos bstan nas /
analyzed: de dag la ngas chos bstan nas /
translated: I taught them the Dharma,🔽and they went away after having found what they were looking for, having found what they had to find.

original: de dag gis rnyed par bya ba rnyed de mthong bar 'gyur ba rnyed nas dong ba de ni khyod kyis zhal ta byas pa 'bras bu yod par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis rnyed par bya ba rnyed de mthong bar 'gyur ba rnyed nas dong ba de ni khyod kyis zhal ta byas pa 'bras bu yod par gyur te /
translated: You have been successful in your service to them.

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos de dag gi nye du rnams la'ang shes par byas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos de dag gi nye du rnams la'ang shes par byas te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana informed the relatives of those hungry ghosts,

original: de dag gis thos nas mchog tu ya mtshan du gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis thos nas mchog tu ya mtshan du gyur te /
translated: and when they heard it, they were amazed.

original: bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur nas bkur sti byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur nas bkur sti byas so //
translated: They felt joy toward the Blessed One and honored him.

original: mo'u dgal gyi bu /
analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu /

analyzed: yi dvags mos smras pa /

analyzed: rang gi skras yog pa /

translated: his belly the size of a mountain, his mouth the size of the eye of a needle,

analyzed: phyogs kun nas sha bkum zhing bkum zhing 'tshal ba dang / de gnad la bab ste dkos thag nas nyam thag ba'i skad 'byin te /

analyzed: sdug bsngal drag pa dang / mi @201a *//

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //

translated: Because of the ripening of her actions—lying and swearing—she gave birth to five children a day and ate them.

original: 'dam bu sbyin gyi bu /
analyzed: 'dam bu sbyin gyi bu /

translated: Aṅkura, you should train in such a way that you will not experience such faults as those of that hungry ghost.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /

analyzed: gang po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa brjod pa brgya pa /

analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams dang / @209a *//

original: de'i tshe yangs pa can na grong khyer 'obs shig gi nang na /
analyzed: de'i tshe yangs pa can na grong khyer 'obs shig gi nang na /
translated: He had attained the great higher knowledge of the Dharma, which is endowed with the excellent wisdom of liberation, with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, and with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure.🔽He had attained the great higher knowledge of the Dharma, which is endowed with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, and with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure.🔽He had attained the great higher knowledge of the Dharma, which is endowed with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, and with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure.🔽He had attained the great higher knowledge of the Dharma, which is endowed with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, and with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure.

original: yi dvags zas su skyugs pa za ba /
analyzed: yi dvags zas su skyugs pa za ba /
translated: He had attained the great higher knowledge of the Dharma, which is endowed with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, and with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure.

original: por ba za ba /
analyzed: por ba za ba /
translated: He had attained the great higher knowledge of the Dharma, which is endowed with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure, and with the excellent wisdom of liberation that is pure.

original: ngar snabs dang / gcin gyis 'tsho ba /
analyzed: ngar snabs dang / gcin gyis 'tsho ba /
translated: They live on snot,

original: rnag dang / khrag dang / phyis za ba /
analyzed: rnag dang / khrag dang / phyis za ba /

original: mi bzad pa /
analyzed: mi bzad pa /

original: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba lnga brgya gnas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba lnga brgya gnas so //
translated: and naturally miserable.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: He also said:

original: skyugs pa za zhing bor ba za //
analyzed: skyugs pa za zhing bor ba za //
translated: “They eat vomit and what is thrown away,🔽live on snot and urine,

original: ngar snabs gcin gyis 'tsho ba dang // rnag khrag dang ni phyi sa za //
analyzed: ngar snabs gcin gyis 'tsho ba dang // rnag khrag dang ni phyi sa za //
translated: eat pus, blood, and excrement,

original: mi bzad rang bzhin sdug cing 'dug /
analyzed: mi bzad rang bzhin sdug cing 'dug /

original: yangs pa can de na bram ze zhig kyang 'dug ste /
analyzed: yangs pa can de na bram ze zhig kyang 'dug ste /
translated: In Vaiśālī there lived a certain brahmin.

original: des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /🔽de de dang lhan cig tu rtse dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
analyzed: des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas / de de dang lhan cig tu rtse dga' la dga' mgur spyod do //
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal rank,🔽and he enjoyed himself with her with various kinds of fun and amusement.

analyzed: de rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyod pa las /
translated: While he was enjoying himself with her with various kinds of fun and amusement,

analyzed: chung ma la bu chags nas de'i lus dri nga bar @209b gyur to //
translated: his wife became pregnant, and her body became foul-smelling.

original: de nas bram ze des mtshan mkhan rnams bkug ste dris na /
analyzed: de nas bram ze des mtshan mkhan rnams bkug ste dris na /
translated: Then the brahmin summoned diviners and asked them.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They said,

original: 'di ni lto na khye'u 'dug pa de'i mthu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni lto na khye'u 'dug pa de'i mthu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: “This is the power of the boy in her womb.”

original: re zhig na de zla ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: re zhig na de zla ba brgyad dam /
translated: After some time, she gave birth to a son.🔽

original: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
analyzed: dgu lon pa dang bu byung ste /
translated: After some time, she gave birth to a son.

original: khye'u mdog ngan cing blta na mi sdug la byad ngan po lus mi gtsang bas bsgos pa dri nga ba zhig btsas so //
analyzed: khye'u mdog ngan cing blta na mi sdug la byad ngan po lus mi gtsang bas bsgos pa dri nga ba zhig btsas so //
translated: He was ugly, repulsive, and deformed, his body covered with filth and stinking.

original: de mchog tu mi sdug mod kyi /
analyzed: de mchog tu mi sdug mod kyi /
translated: Although he was extremely ugly,

original: byams pa'i dbang gis sbrel bas pha ma gnyis kyis gsos so //
analyzed: byams pa'i dbang gis sbrel bas pha ma gnyis kyis gsos so //
translated: his parents raised him out of love.

original: de mi gtsang ba'i gnas rnams 'ba' zhig tu dga' la phyag dar gyi phung po dang / phyis khung du skra 'bal zhing khar mi gtsang ba 'dzud nas /
analyzed: de mi gtsang ba'i gnas rnams 'ba' zhig tu dga' la phyag dar gyi phung po dang / phyis khung du skra 'bal zhing khar mi gtsang ba 'dzud nas /
translated: He took delight only in filthy places, and he would pull out his hair in a hole in the ground and put filth in his mouth.

original: de'i ming phyis khung zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i ming phyis khung zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: He became known as “Filth-Hole.”

original: re zhig na de phan tshun du 'khyam pa las 'od srung rdzogs byed kyis mthong nas /
analyzed: re zhig na de phan tshun du 'khyam pa las 'od srung rdzogs byed kyis mthong nas /
translated: One day, Pūraṇa Kāśyapa saw him wandering around.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought,

original: 'di de lta bu'i gnas rnams su dga' ba las na 'di ni gor ma chags par grub pa'i skyes bu zhig yin gyi bdag gis 'dir rab tu dbyung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di de lta bu'i gnas rnams su dga' ba las na 'di ni gor ma chags par grub pa'i skyes bu zhig yin gyi bdag gis 'dir rab tu dbyung ngo snyam mo //
translated: “Since he delights in such places, he must be an accomplished person. I will give him ordination.”

original: des de rab tu phyung nas gcer bur 'khyam zhing 'dug la /
analyzed: des de rab tu phyung nas gcer bur 'khyam zhing 'dug la /
translated: He gave him the going forth, and he wandered about naked.

original: legs pa byed pa la'ang gnas so //
analyzed: legs pa byed pa la'ang gnas so //
translated: He also stayed in places where good deeds were done.

original: de nas de 'khyam zhing song ba las yangs pa can gyi 'obs kyi nang na yi dvags lnga brgya 'khod pa rnams mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas de 'khyam zhing song ba las yangs pa can gyi 'obs kyi nang na yi dvags lnga brgya 'khod pa rnams mthong nas /
translated: Then, as he was wandering about, he saw five hundred hungry ghosts living in the moat of Śrāvastī.

original: de sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pas grong khyer gyi 'obs de'i nang du song nas de dag dang lhan cig 'dus shing phrad de /
analyzed: de sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'brel pas grong khyer gyi 'obs de'i nang du song nas de dag dang lhan cig 'dus shing phrad de /
translated: Because of the ripening of his past karma, he went into the moat of that city and stayed there with them.

original: dga' bar gyur nas grogs por gyur to //
analyzed: dga' bar gyur nas grogs por gyur to //
translated: They gathered together, met, and became friends.

original: phyis re zhig na khye'u phyis khung don zhig la brel te yangs pa can du song ngo //
analyzed: phyis re zhig na khye'u phyis khung don zhig la brel te yangs pa can du song ngo //
translated: Later, the boy Kumbhīra went to Śrāvastī on some business.

original: bcom ldan @210a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan @210a *//
translated: The Blessed One

original: 'das kyang grong khyer gyi 'obs der byon nas yi dvags de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'das kyang grong khyer gyi 'obs der byon nas yi dvags de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: also went to the moat of that city. The hungry ghosts saw the Blessed Buddha, his body well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus mdzes par byas pa /
translated: beautified by the eighty minor marks,

original: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa /
translated: He was adorned with a halo extending one fathom,

original: nyi ma stong pas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
analyzed: nyi ma stong pas lhag pa'i 'od mnga' ba /
translated: and his radiance surpassed a thousand suns.

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba lta bu kun nas bzang pa mthong ngo //
translated: He was as beautiful as a moving mountain of jewels.

original: mthong ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas /
translated: As soon as they saw him, they bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag phongs lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag cag phongs lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, we are in distress.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One asked,

original: khyed cis phongs /
analyzed: khyed cis phongs /
translated: “What is your distress?”

original: yi dvags rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: yi dvags rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The hungry ghosts said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bdag cag ni skom lags so //
analyzed: bdag cag ni skom lags so //
translated: we are thirsty.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag sor lnga las yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu'i rgyun lnga phab ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag sor lnga las yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu'i rgyun lnga phab ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One caused a stream of water with eight qualities to flow from his five fingers.

original: des yi dvags lnga brgya po de dag tshim par mdzad do //
analyzed: des yi dvags lnga brgya po de dag tshim par mdzad do //
translated: It satisfied the five hundred hungry ghosts.

original: de nas de dag bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de dag bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur te /
translated: Then they felt joy toward the Blessed One.

original: shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes so; ;lha'i bu'am /
analyzed: shi nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes so; ;lha'i bu'am /
translated: When they died, they were reborn in the excellent realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems rnam pa gsum skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i bu mo skyes nas ring po ma lon pa ni chos nyid kyis sems rnam pa gsum skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is natural that a newly born celestial maiden will have three thoughts:

original: gang nas shi 'phos /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos /
translated: “Where did I die?

original: gang du skyes /
analyzed: gang du skyes /
translated: Where was I born?

original: las gang gis ksyes snyam mo //
analyzed: las gang gis ksyes snyam mo //
translated: What action caused that?”

original: de nas yi dvags las shi 'phos pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur par de dag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas yi dvags las shi 'phos pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha yul bzang por skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la sems dga' bar gyur par de dag gis mthong ngo //
translated: Then they saw that they had died as hungry ghosts, were born in the excellent celestial realm of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, and that their minds had become filled with joy toward the Blessed One.

original: de nas @210b sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas @210b sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the gods who had previously been hungry ghosts thought,

original: bdag cag zhag lon te /
analyzed: bdag cag zhag lon te /
translated: “It is not right for us to wait a day

original: gzod bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir /🔽'gro ba ni bdag cag gi cha ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzod bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir / 'gro ba ni bdag cag gi cha ma yin gyi /
translated: before going to see the Blessed One.

original: bdag cag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'dong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag cag zhag ma lon par bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir 'dong ngo snyam mo //
translated: We should go to see the Blessed One right away.”

original: de nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa /
analyzed: de nas sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dag cing 'gul pa thogs pa /
translated: Then the gods who had previously been hungry ghosts, wearing earrings and necklaces,

original: lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
analyzed: lus do shal dang / se mo dos brgyan pa /
translated: Their bodies were adorned with necklaces and bracelets.

original: nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i cod pan can /
translated: They wore crowns studded with various jewels.

original: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa de rnams kyi de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
analyzed: lus gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma dang / spri ka la sogs pas byugs pa de rnams kyi de nyid kyi mtshan mo lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu da dang / padma dkar po dang / man d'a ra rnams kyis thu ba bkang ste /
translated: Their bodies were anointed with saffron, tamala leaves, spṛka, and so forth. That night, they filled the laps of the bodhisattvas with divine flowers of utpala, padma, kumuda, puṇḍarīka, and coral tree flowers.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa'i gnas thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa'i gnas thams cad 'od chen pos snang bar byas nas /
translated: They illuminated the entire multistoried building with a great light.

original: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
translated: They scattered flowers over the Bhagavat.

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: They sat before the Bhagavat in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon yi dvags su gyur pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the sons of gods who had previously been hungry ghosts, taught them the Dharma accordingly, so that they realized the four truths of the noble ones.

original: de thos nas lha'i bu lnga brgyas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
analyzed: de thos nas lha'i bu lnga brgyas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas /
translated: Having heard it, the five hundred sons of gods destroyed with the vajra of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: and attained the fruit of stream entry.🔽Having seen the truths, they were like merchants who had found profit,

original: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa dang / zhing @211a *//
analyzed: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas tshong pa khe spogs phyin pa dang / zhing @211a *//
translated: like farmers who had reaped a good harvest,🔽like those who had been freed from a disaster,🔽like those who had been freed from a great illness,🔽and like those who had been freed from prison.

original: pa 'bru rgyal bar gyur pa dang / dpa' bo g-yul las rgyal ba dang / nad pa nad thams cad las thar ba bzhin du 'byor ba gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du lhags pa'i 'byor ba de nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas rang gi gnas su dong ngo //
analyzed: pa 'bru rgyal bar gyur pa dang / dpa' bo g-yul las rgyal ba dang / nad pa nad thams cad las thar ba bzhin du 'byor ba gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du lhags pa'i 'byor ba de nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas rang gi gnas su dong ngo //
translated: He was like a farmer who has had a good harvest, like a hero who has won a battle, like a sick person who has been cured of every disease. With the same splendor with which he had come into the Buddha’s presence, he circumambulated the Blessed One three times and then departed for his own home.

original: de nas khye'u phyi sa khung grong khyer gyi 'obs su 'ongs pa dang / yi dvags de dag ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas khye'u phyi sa khung grong khyer gyi 'obs su 'ongs pa dang / yi dvags de dag ma mthong ngo //
translated: Then the boy came to the moat of Sūrpāraka, but he did not see the hungry ghosts.

original: de nas tshol ba la zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshol ba la zhugs te /
translated: He began to search for them.

original: de de dag yongs su tshol bas skyo bar 'gyur la de dag ni ma rnyed do //🔽de'i skabs su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni mi mkhyen pa'am /🔽mi gzigs pa'am /
analyzed: de de dag yongs su tshol bas skyo bar 'gyur la de dag ni ma rnyed do // de'i skabs su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni mi mkhyen pa'am / mi gzigs pa'am /
translated: He became exhausted from searching for them, but he did not find them.

original: mi rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa'am /
translated: At that time, there is nothing that the blessed buddhas do not know, do not see, do not understand, and do not comprehend.

original: thugs su mi chud pa zhig ci yang med la /
analyzed: thugs su mi chud pa zhig ci yang med la /
translated: There is nothing that they do not know,🔽do not see,🔽do not understand,🔽and do not comprehend.
